properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 18 at 8:19AM EST until February 20 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo NY
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, wet and slushy snow
gradually changing to rain by midday. Additional snow
accumulations of 2 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40
mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy lake effect snow
possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches possible in
the most persistent lake snows.

* WHERE...Oswego county.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon EST today.
For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday evening through
Thursday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel this morning will be difficult due to snow and
slush covered roads. The hazardous conditions will impact the
morning commute. Another period of difficult travel is possible
Wednesday night into Thursday morning due to heavy lake effect
snow and poor visibility.
properties.instruction:
Periods of snow will result in snow covered roads and limited
visibilities. Slow down and use caution while driving.

Submit snow reports through our website or social media.

Narrow bands of heavy snow Wednesday night into Thursday could
impact portions of the region. Localized travel problems will be
possible.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON
